<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for(Iterator<DataSnapshot> it = dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
i = i + 1;
names.add(it.next().getValue(String.class));
}

Explanation: You're creating a new dataSnapshot.getChildren().iterator() in every iteration of your loop. Try to just use the value of the foreach inside the loop.

For switching between two windows in Selenium using Java, you can use the `driver.switchTo().window()` method to switch to a new window.
Here is an example of how you can use this method to switch to a new window:
```
WebDriver driver = new ChromeDriver();
driver.get("https://www.google.com");
WebDriver newWindow = driver.findElement(By.id("newWindow"));
newWindow.click();
driver.switchTo().window(newWindow);
```
You can also use this method to switch back to the previous window:
```
driver.switchTo().window(driver.getWindowHandle());
```
Please note that this method is only available in ChromeDriver and other drivers that support the `Window` interface.
